intro: Cacalia lutea, commonly known as the yellow bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Cacalia lutea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
